subject: Handle unreadable hashes.pkl same way as non-existent or corrupt
commit_message:
Handle unreadable hashes.pkl same way as non-existent or corrupt

If hashes.pkl does not exist or does not contain pickled data then
hashes is set to None which triggers an attempt to create a valid
hashes.pkl.

In contrast, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read then hashes
is explicitly set to an empty dict, which may not trigger any
attempt to write a valid hashes.pkl.

Furthermore, if hashes.pkl exists but cannot be read and
hashes.invalid has invalidations, then the invalidated suffixes
will be added to an empty hashes dict and written to a new
hashes.pkl file, losing any prior suffix hash state.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>

subject: WSMAN enumerate fails to return all entries
commit_message:
WSMAN enumerate fails to return all entries

When querying an enumeration using the WSMAN enumerate method, not all
entries are returned if there are more than max_elems (default of 100)
in the enumeration.

When querying an enumeration, the first response returns <wsman:Items>
in the body.  Successive pulls, however, contain <wsen:Items>.

The old code always queried for <wsen:Items>, which caused the first
batch of attributes to be dropped only when the number of entries in
the enumeration exceeded max_elems.

This patch queries for <wsman:Items> in the first response, and for
<wsen:Items> in successive responses.

Change-Id: I2e9036b562c7d7ba5af188dd552b6c67388bb02c
Closes-Bug: #1659052

subject: Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..
commit_message:
Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..

Right now, image creation/deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage relies on self.repair_image
to clean up the class-level image through the UI. This has
several potential points of failure:

 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup:
   if the test fails before repair_image is called, the image
   is not restored.
 - self.repair_image is done via UI: this can obviously fail,
   because Selenium should never be used to reliably clean up
   a resource.
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase: this can result in failures in other
   test suites.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

This is an example of a log that shows multiple tests failing
across different test suites because the class-level image
(probably) was already deleted and thus not found:

https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/25/424525/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/ca45725/

subject: Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files
commit_message:
Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files

In current implementation, object-server copies 'X-Static-Large-Object'
from .data files of slo manifest objects to .meta files when users make
request of fast-POST. However, it will cause a problem in split brain
case as follows:

State1: An user PUT manifest object with t0 timestamp.

State2: Split brain happens.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    | manifest(t0) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State3: An user PUT a new object which is not manifest
        in brain1 with t1 timestamp.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State4: An user POST to the manifest in brain2 with t2 timestamp.
        In this case, the .meta file will have 'X-Static-Large-Object'
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    |              |   .meta(t2)  |
    +--------------+--------------+

State5: Split brain is solved. The new object has
        'X-Static-Large-Object' nevertheless it is not manifest object.
    +-----------------------------+
    |         merged brain        |
    +-----------------------------+
    |          new_obj(t1)        |
    |           .meta(t2)         |
    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object' metadata, and
fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d
Closes-Bug:#1634723

subject: placement: report client handle InventoryInUse
commit_message:
placement: report client handle InventoryInUse

In a Newton deployment, Ironic baremetal nodes are added as resource
providers to the placement service. Those resource providers will
typically have 3 inventory records, one each for VCPU, MEMORY_MB, and
DISK_GB. In an Ocata deployment, the Nova resource tracker is going to
switch to tracking Ironic baremetal nodes having a single inventory
record corresponding to the Ironic node's "resource_class" attribute (a
custom resource class).

When this happens, we will need to rework allocation records against
that baremetal node provider since we will not be able to delete the
inventory records that refer to the old resource classes like VCPU,
MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB until those old allocation records are removed.

This patch catches the 409 Conflict returned from the placement service
when an InventoryInUse exception occurs and re-raises this exception on
the client side, allowing us a way in future patches to differentiate
between a ConcurrentUpdateDetected and the issue described above.

Change-Id: Ie52e495945b7b3db5ae777804c50260e3324e0ea

subject: Disables QoS policy pull optimization for following reasons:
commit_message:
Disables QoS policy pull optimization for following reasons:

1. It is not safe to assume that the port will always get
   scheduled on same compute.
2. It assumes that the rules under policy did not change
   between prev instance delete and new instance create.
3. It doesn't pull port policy when same port is used for
   booting different instance (after prev instance is deleted)
4. Disabling this code allows pull of policy and proper
   enforcement of policy to the port.

When using the 'groups' keyword in a federation mapping, the value
passed in the assertion map be a simple string with a space. For
example, "ALL USERS". This results in ast.literal_eval() raising
a SyntaxError and not ValueError, which bubbles up to the API as
an uncaught 500 Internal Server Error.

subject: Add a script to zero /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables at build time
commit_message:
Add a script to zero /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables at build time

In change Iddc21316a1a3d42a1a43cbb4b9c178adba8f8db3 we zeroed out
/etc/sysconfig/iptables, but we did not take care of ipv6. This change
is meant to take of the ipv6 part of the problem.
When including this element we empty the stock /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables
file as shipped by the iptables rpm package. The reason for this is that
puppet firewall has a hard time to cope with exiting rules when
/etc/sysconfig/iptables is populated and the iptables service is not
active. The referenced bug has a full explanation for the problem.

Note that ipv6 is slightly more delicate because we will also need a puppet-tripleo
change that implements the dhcpv6 rule that is contained by default
in /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables:

subject: Add a default rule for dhcpv6 traffic
commit_message:
Add a default rule for dhcpv6 traffic

Via bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1657108 we need
to zero out the default rules in /etc/sysconfig/ip{6}tables in
the image.
We have done this for ipv4, but when we will do it for ipv6 we
will also need to make sure we add a rule for dhcpv6 traffic
as it is shipped in the iptables rpm. (See
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1169036 for more info)

With this change we correctly get the rule present (aka the first
ACCEPT line. The second line is due to the stock ip6tables rule
I had in my testing):
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL |grep 546
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# ip6tables -nvL |grep 546
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 multiport dports 546 /* 004 accept ipv6 dhcpv6 ipv6 */ state NEW
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 udp dpt:546 state NEW

Change-Id: If22080054b2b1fa7acfd101e8c34d2707e8e7864
Partial-Bug: #1657108
